messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: [Unschooling-dotcom ]dialects
messages.msgSnippet: ... Depends whether you re looking at the ground or the sky.    The wet coast, aka west. ... I ve never been to Trawnuh.  I did drive all the way from
messages.messageBody:
>
>Tia, are you closer to the left or right coast? or in the middle?

Depends whether you're looking at the ground or the sky. <g> The wet
coast, aka west.


>I ask because I've run across this attitude (which I find quite amusing,
>no I don't take it to heart) in the area relative close to Toronto,
>Oakville to be exact. Mostly settled by the English and predominantly
>still very much that way.

I've never been to Trawnuh. I did drive all the way from Vancouver to New
Brunswick once, but we avoided Trawnuh.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom ]dialects
messages.msgSnippet: ... Tia, are you closer to the left or right coast? or in the middle? I ask because I ve run across this attitude (which I find quite amusing, no I don t take
messages.messageBody:
>And I should add that I sound pretty much like all the born-in-Canada
>people who live around me. Tia


Tia, are you closer to the left or right coast? or in the middle?

I ask because I've run across this attitude (which I find quite amusing,
no I don't take it to heart) in the area relative close to Toronto,
Oakville to be exact. Mostly settled by the English and predominantly
still very much that way.

kolleen
